channel.title: Animal Agriculture Alliance
channel.description: Safeguarding the future of animal ag

item.title: 5 reasons you should support animal agriculture this Giving Tuesday
item.description:
This Giving Tuesday, December 2, we invite you to support the Animal Agriculture Alliance in safeguarding the future of animal agriculture, and all those who make it possible. 

The post 5 reasons you should support animal agriculture this Giving Tuesday   appeared first on Animal Agriculture Alliance.

item.title: How to advocate for agriculture on your college campus
item.description:
Animal agriculture advocacy comes in many different forms, each with the common goal of building trust between producers and the public, encouraging transparency, and supporting responsible, sustainable practices within the industry. Whether it’s a farmer sharing their daily life on social media, an industry expert speaking at an educational event, or a student participating in youth programs like 4-H and FFA, advocacy is happening all around us. You can find it in barns, classrooms, online platforms, community events, and even at family dinner tables. Each setting presents a valuable opportunity to tell agriculture’s story. 

The post How to advocate for agriculture on your college campus  appeared first on Animal Agriculture Alliance.

item.title: Mental Health in Animal Agriculture: Discussing the challenges
item.description:
Amid the golden fields and early morning routines, a silent struggle is occurring in the agriculture community—mental health. While farmers and ranchers are known for their resilience and grit, the weight of isolation, financial pressures, unpredictable weather, and generational expectations can take a heavy toll. It’s time to break the silence and acknowledge that mental well-being is just as vital as physical health. I want to take a moment to shine a light on the unique challenges faced by those who feed the world—and why mental health awareness has become part of the conversation in rural America.  

The post Mental Health in Animal Agriculture: Discussing the challenges   appeared first on Animal Agriculture Alliance.

item.title: Beat the heat: Keeping animals cool in the summer
item.description:
Summer is often characterized by a few common things: the smell of freshly cut grass, splashing in a pool, or eating meat off the grill. There’s also one undeniable factor about the summer: it can get hot. Not only do we have to endure the heat, but our animals do too.

The post Beat the heat: Keeping animals cool in the summer appeared first on Animal Agriculture Alliance.

item.title: Meat vs. Myth: What you need to know about red meat
item.description:
To me, there are three quintessential things about the summer season— warm evenings, time spent outdoors, and the classic sizzle of meat on a grill.

The post Meat vs. Myth: What you need to know about red meat  appeared first on Animal Agriculture Alliance.

item.title: 10 Reasons to Compete in CAO
item.description:
With so many different directions students can take, one thing is key for the success of students and the field as a whole: effective communication with people not actively involved in or familiar with agriculture.

The post 10 Reasons to Compete in CAO appeared first on Animal Agriculture Alliance.

item.title: Everything You Need to Know About College Aggies Online
item.description:
Everyone is involved in agriculture in one way or another – whether that is growing up on a farm or even just eating the food bought at the grocery store. To bridge the communication gap between farm and fork, college students from across the country come together each fall for a scholarship program that encourages them to do just that.

The post Everything You Need to Know About College Aggies Online appeared first on Animal Agriculture Alliance.

item.title: The role of livestock in regenerative agriculture
item.description:
Today, there are a plethora of ongoing discussions about large-scale farming and its impact on sustainability. With the adoption of regenerative practices, large-scale farms improve the health of soil, the animal, the economic resiliency of the farm, and can contribute to biodiverse conservation efforts.  

The post The role of livestock in regenerative agriculture appeared first on Animal Agriculture Alliance.

item.title: Beef Labels Busted: What’s Really on Your Plate?
item.description:
In a world full of food labels and dietary advice, it’s easy to feel overwhelmed at the meat counter. This article breaks down common beef labels like grass-fed, grain-finished, and more—so you can make informed choices that align with your health goals and personal values.

The post Beef Labels Busted: What’s Really on Your Plate?  appeared first on Animal Agriculture Alliance.

item.title: States rolling back legislation on cage-free eggs
item.description:
Egg prices have soared recently, leaving many consumers wondering why. While avian influenza plays a role, animal housing mandates—like California's Proposition 12—are also driving up costs.

The post States rolling back legislation on cage-free eggs appeared first on Animal Agriculture Alliance.
